description:
This is a good quality extension that gives you a taskbar or panel reminiscent of Windows or Cinnamon desktops (as in the Cinnamon desktop environment available on linux mint and elsewhere) - basically a more traditional taskbar/panel. It lets you put the panel at the bottom of the screen (and customise size and colour), puts the app dash on the panel (with favorites, open apps, and a button for the full app menu), and has mouseover thumbnails for selecting windows (like Cinnamon).

It's even slicker and better for customisation than a Cinnamon panel in some respects. You can select transparent or gradient fills for the panel background, and it gives you more control over icon size, padding, open window indicators etc. than Cinnamon does as far as I can tell.

One thing to be aware of is that this will make your dash be absent from the overhead view (ie. when you press the super key or click 'activities') which to me isn't ideal, and I haven't yet found a way to have both.
summary: Great extension - slick, well realised, and plenty of customisation

description: Works vertical and horizontal, has lots of options, shows everything you need in a concise way, and on vertical mode compliments very well the Ubuntu theme and visual identity without wasting vertical space on a useless top bar.
